channel.title: Tutorial didn't work on my cleaned client [PI]
channel.description:
[center][size=12pt]First off, I'm using the client from this thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,640976.0.html And I used this tutorial: http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/snippets/470192-pi-tab-reply.html I did everything right, I'm 100% positive, don't suggest I didn't.
Any ideas?[/size][/center]

item.title: Tutorial didn't work on my cleaned client [PI]
item.dc:creator: @PI_Developer PI_Developer
item.description:
@PI_Developer wrote:

I will when you get online

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial didn't work on my cleaned client [PI]
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

i used this guide 5 minutes ago.
private message me your teamviewer id and pass

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial didn't work on my cleaned client [PI]

item.title: Tutorial didn't work on my cleaned client [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“PI_Developer, post:7, topic:526294”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=645037.msg4339377#msg4339377 date=1374911116]

This is your third thread on the same topic. Please stop making topics for the same thing, and did you add setFocusTraversalKeysEnabled(false); to your Jframe?

Well I wanna get it all done and over with!

I did everything right, I’m 100% positive, don’t suggest I didn’t.

Yes. Yes I did.

Just because you say it, I always double check, sometimes people don’t always do every step.

Also, how were you testing?

Once I got all the compiling errors fixed and got it how it was supposed to be, I used 2 accounts on 2 clients and pmed one, then tried to hit tab on the other one but nothing happened. I think I have to enable or call the tab key somewhere but I don’t know where

SetfocusTraverseKey is what enables the tab key (along with the j==9)
I’ve used this tutorial in the past and I know it works.

Edit: The tut author said this:

And other people such as dead fury could only get it to work with Ctrl key for some reason lol.

Try using ctrl? lol
[/quote]
If I was using her guide that she said was the first to get the tab key to work instead of Ctrl, why would I need to try the control?
And for the record, I did right after the tab key didn’t work.

Contradiction like a BITCH.[/quote]
I’m just trying to help, and I see no reason why it isn’t working, unless you didn’t initialize it correctly or missed a step.

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial didn't work on my cleaned client [PI]

Also, how were you testing?

Once I got all the compiling errors fixed and got it how it was supposed to be, I used 2 accounts on 2 clients and pmed one, then tried to hit tab on the other one but nothing happened. I think I have to enable or call the tab key somewhere but I don’t know where
[/quote]
SetfocusTraverseKey is what enables the tab key (along with the j==9)
I’ve used this tutorial in the past and I know it works.

Edit: The tut author said this:

And other people such as dead fury could only get it to work with Ctrl key for some reason lol.

Try using ctrl? lol[/quote]
If I was using her guide that she said was the first to get the tab key to work instead of Ctrl, why would I need to try the control?
And for the record, I did right after the tab key didn’t work.

Contradiction like a BITCH.
